titles.title: Recognizing the importance of Ralph Bunche as one of the great leaders of the United States, the first African-American Nobel Peace Prize winner, an accomplished scholar, a distinguished diplomat, and a tireless campaigner of civil rights for people throughout the world.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 11/22/2003--Passed Senate without amendment. Recognizes Ralph Bunche as a pivotal 20th century figure and fighter in the struggle for human rights on a global scale. Urges the President to take appropriate measures to encourage the celebration and remembrance of Ralph Bunche's many significant achievements.
